annonstext:
Northvolt has an exciting job offer for an Aftermarket Application Engineer to join our dynamic and exciting team in Stockholm. 

The Aftermarket Application Engineer works in close collaboration with customers to develop methods and logic for commissioning, operation, troubleshooting and service of our cutting edge connected battery systems. 

In joining our team, you will get the chance to have a real impact on our success story and see the results of your work in a dynamic and challenging environment. You are independent, analytical, and focused, pursuing the best possible solutions to the problems you face. The team you will join is energetic and high performing, with a strong team spirit, supporting each other on the exciting journey to enable the future of energy.

Key responsibilities

 - Map and analyze software and hardware related functions, diving deep into the functionality of the battery systems
 - Develop methods, needs and requirements for future SW & HW functionality, continuously integrating the aftermarket and customer perspective, setting the application of the product in its intended environment as central
 - Collaborate cross-functionally with different R&D teams at Northvolt Battery Systems

Apply with your CV or your complete LinkedIn profile. We will offer a full time employment with fixed salary. Planned starting date is asap or as agreed.


Education/Experience

 - Master’s in Engineering, preferably within Mechanical, Electrical, Mechatronics, Computer Sciences or Applied Physics
 - 3+ years experience from working with customer applications
 - Preferred experience from development of battery management systems and/or charging systems
 - Preferred experience within the renewable energy field

Specific Skills/Abilities

 - Excellent English written and oral skills, Swedish is a plus
 - Strong interest in software, control systems and the interaction between humans and machines
 - Comfortable troubleshooting low voltage electronics, reading schematics and understanding system designs, as well as diving into the functionality of the battery management system software
 - Ability to work self-sufficiently under high pressure and tight deadlines
 - Ability to travel on a frequent basis

Your personal characteristics include excellent analytical and critical thinking skills, as well as technical role-related competence. You are passionate about technology, innovation and sustainability, bold in pursuing the best possible solutions, a have a constant drive to learn more. 

Northvolt makes green batteries for a blue planet. Affordable cells and high-quality battery systems. All manufactured with a record-low carbon footprint. Purposely built to provide Europe with the opportunity to switch to renewable energy – efficiently and entirely.

To accomplish this, we do things differently. We design, manufacture, and recycle everything under one roof. We even build our own factories. All this is incredibly challenging and requires us to think in unconventional ways. We’re constantly experimenting, learning and adapting to make batteries so great – they will one day make oil history.

Northvolt is growing fast. We’re staffing our international office in Stockholm, our R&D facility, Northvolt Labs, in Västerås, as well as our Gdansk facility for production of battery systems. We're also hiring for our two gigafactories: Northvolt Ett in Skellefteå, Sweden, and Northvolt Zwei in Salzgitter, Germany. We want to work with smart individuals from all disciplines. Strong individuals that truly want to make a positive impact on the future. Those of us already on board share a passion for our mission. We’re prepared to work hard in pursuit of excellence. We enjoy the ride and our main drive is to make a difference for real. As a team, we’re dedicated to thinking new, working hard and having fun.
